web_research.query: How do Kaggle winners approach text classification problems with both text and meta features?
web_research.finding:
Based on winning solutions from several Kaggle NLP competitions, the most common workflow for text‑classification tasks that also have numerical or categorical “meta” features is:

1. **Clean the raw data and engineer simple meta features** – remove special characters, URLs, HTML tags and emojis; then create quantitative descriptors such as text length, proportion of uppercase characters, or any domain‑specific numeric/categorical fields. These engineered features often carry strong signal (e.g., upper‑case ratio was a key predictor in the Jigsaw toxicity competition) ([radurobu GitHub](https://github.com/radurobu/Jigsaw-Comments-Kaggle-Competition)).

2. **Encode the text with a pre‑trained transformer** – fine‑tune a model like BERT or RoBERTa on the competition data to obtain contextual embeddings for each document ([FreeAgent engineering blog](https://engineering.freeagent.com/2024/05/17/combining-text-with-numerical-and-categorical-features-for-classification); [McCormick blog](ht
